content.question: The use of steel made it possible for the Carson, Pirie, Scott and Company Building to have which of the following architectural innovations?

choices.label: Steam-powered elevators that enabled access to multiple stories
An open floor plan and large expanses of glass
Cantilevered terraces surrounding a central courtyard
An elevated spire supporting a radio transmitter

content.answer: An open floor plan and large expanses of glass

topic.text: 4.3: Materials, Processes, and Techniques in Later European and American Art

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Explain how artistic decisions about form, style, materials, technique, and/or content shape a work of art (or group of related works of art).
